intro: Koanophyllon subpurpureum, commonly known as the purpleleaf bluecurls, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage and showy, blue-violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a bluish-purple hue, which contributes to its common name. Koanophyllon subpurpureum is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it thrives in full sun.
